abstract.p: New Jersey Transit plans to supply shuttle buses to several cities next spring to transport commuters to and from train and bus stations as part of federal transportation grant (S)

block.p: New Jersey Transit announced last week that it will supply shuttle buses to Clifton, Secaucus, Rutherford, Glen Ridge, Maplewood, Orange, South Orange, Marlboro, Red Bank, Rahway, Edison, Metuchen, New Brunswick, Hackensack, North Plainfield and Old Bridge, plus Atlantic and Camden Counties. The 20-passenger vans, which will arrive next spring, will be used to transport commuters to and from train and bus stations. New Jersey Transit was awarded $3 million in federal transportation funds to buy the vans and is anticipating $3 million more next winter to expand the program.
